Distrib' ( 2016 )

"Distrib is a distributed calculation software made using Python and C# (with WPF). It allows you to generate a server that will distribute parts of calculations to many computers in order to solve them faster.
Just send your users the client app so they can help you !"

1. Speech

Distrib is an app we (my friend Alexandre DELALOY and myself) had to build for our bachelor's degree.

90% of it has been made with Python. The other software that lets you generate a server has been made using C# and WPF technology.

My job here was to build the whole back-end side (calculation split, client-server communications, etc...).

It wasn't easy at first to find out how I could split calculations, but it feels really nice when you finally have THE solution.

I'm very proud of our job (even if our final mark is of 18/20 (although for the questions about security that had nothing to do with our project)) !

Should you use it ?

Probably not, it's definitely not the best one of the market, but take a look to the code at least, so you can get an idea of how I think.

ClipboardZanager ( 2017 )

"ClipboardZanager is a project made by Etienne BAUDOUX. It‚Äôs a clipboard manager, which means it allows you to keep an history of all the things you‚Äôve copied. Copied stuffs can be synchronized with the cloud, so you can retrieve those from another device."

1. Speech

I‚Äôve been collaborating on this project for one month only.

The main functionality I added was a setting that allows the user whether passwords and credit card numbers should be synchronized with the cloud (everything is synced by default, except passwords and credit card numbers (thanks to this new feature)).

It took me a bit of time to figure out how everything was linked, and where I had to put my piece of code. Once this was done, it was really nice to see how a big project is structured.

I‚Äôve also worked on another feature, which was the default icon when the app‚Äôs icon (from which the data is copied) couldn‚Äôt be found (for whatever reason).

This project was the first one where I had the opportunity to work in group using tools such has versioning ones (Github). It took me away from my habit of working solo.
